TopicTitle: KSP Interstellar Extended Continued Development Thread

Articles.Content:
3 hours ago, SpaceMouse said:

Thanks! It's definitely symmetric, i only usually model 1/4, mirror modifier is my friend.

I'm probably going to scale down the MHD's again, i can't imagine any reactors would have reactor outputs this big, and then super- high velocity exaust doesn't need to make a right- angle turn at the top.

Oh no, don't make it smaller, if you need more room for the angle, make it longer. Yes, reactors possible realy do have that output. The bigger, they high throttle it is able to use, and therefore convert into power. Currently this is still 100% but it has to go down with the current size generators, they are very much undersized.

Edited October 26, 2016 by FreeThinker

2 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:

Oh no, don't make it smaller, if you need more room for the angle, make it longer. Yes, reactors possible realy do have that output. The bigger, they high throttle it is able to use, and therefore convert into power. Currently this is still 100% but it has to go down with the current size generators, they are very much undersized.

Gah. I was half way through fixing it. It has to be 3x the length of the other ones, but i can leave it i suppose. I had a alternate idea earlier about designing the bottom so it sort of wraps around a attached reactor but, I'm not sure how that would look ingame.

3 hours ago, SpaceMouse said:

Gah. I was half way through fixing it. It has to be 3x the length of the other ones, but i can leave it i suppose. I had a alternate idea earlier about designing the bottom so it sort of wraps around a attached reactor but, I'm not sure how that would look ingame.

Constraints are a good thing, it makes people creative

Edited October 26, 2016 by FreeThinker

Got a question/problem. I've noticed that both in a fully upgraded career mode & in sandbox mode, all reactors power output are stuck at mk3, rather than upgrading through mk4 to 5. What is the cause of this and how may I fix it?

22 minutes ago, Ciliate said:

Got a question/problem. I've noticed that both in a fully upgraded career mode & in sandbox mode, all reactors power output are stuck at mk3, rather than upgrading through mk4 to 5. What is the cause of this and how may I fix it?

It is not a bug that they don't upgrade higher, the only mistake here is that they system gives you the idea it does because in the VAB it promises this, but that just a default calculation.

Got it in game after a minor technical difficulty. Its at least 3x as long as the large generator.

This reactor is doing nothing. I have no idea what I'm doing.

 

Edited October 26, 2016 by SpaceMouse

9 hours ago, SpaceMouse said:


This reactor is doing nothing. I have no idea what I'm doing.

The Colliding Beam Fusion reactor is aneutron and cannot be connect with a thermal generator. Use another reactor, for instance, the Gas Core Reactor, which this generator is intended for

 

 

 

Edited October 27, 2016 by FreeThinker

@FreeThinker Isn't my magnetic nozzle supposed to be variable ISP? It appears to be staying at 12000 currently and burning through hydrogen very quickly.

I'm working on a little attach thing on the bottom of the generator. I should have it for you in a few hours.

I'm also going to update my magnetic nozzle soon, i see obvious noob mistakes now that are easy to correct.

Edited October 27, 2016 by SpaceMouse

I have a new idea for a thing to add! The Sample Capsule, if on the surface of a body, picks up samples and analyzes them. You can analyze the samples on site, or return them to the best labs on Kerbin for a greater science return.

I have a new idea for a thing to add! The Sample Capsule, if on the surface of a body, picks up samples and analyzes them. You can analyze the samples on site, or return them to the best labs on Kerbin for a greater science return.

Hi KAL 9000 if you want to make an RTG maybe you can maybe do the Advanced Stirling radioisotope generator.

I never got around to doing one and would like to see one where the stirling engine is actually animated.

Yes it should, is it broken?

2 hours ago, FreeThinker said:

Yes it should, is it broken?

 

 

 

Appears to be

Question, maybe i don´t get it, but about that microwave transmitters. So i tryed every way i could think off, but it seems like i got no activate transmission button. I can Link Reciver, activate receiver, activate relay but under no circumstances i get a button activate transmission. What i do wrong O.o

Tryed it with solar panels to generate power, with some fission reactors, on the ground, in space, with different transmission dishes.

I thought maybe they send power automaticly now (I only used it in the old Interstellar Version a couple of times) but i cannot beam any energy to a test rocket with a  microwave thermal receiver.

Edited October 29, 2016 by Ferigad

@Ferigad

Before a transmitter can transmit, it need a source of Power in the specific medium your transmitter is capable of sending. In the case microwave transmitter, this is the Gyrotron. Currently, you need to have your transmitter connected directly to a Beam Generator, before it is able to transmit. Next release will make this more explicitly clear in the part descriptions. Note there are also secondary limitations, most transmitters are not suitable to act act as transmitter from the surface, this has to do with the ability to pivot, the transmitter mist be able transmit the microwave signal in any direction of the sky.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Edited October 29, 2016 by FreeThinker
Hi I know this is kind of insane, but is there a way to with multiple satellites to beam 5TW of power to a single vessel?

1 minute ago, torchard96 said:

Hi I know this is kind of insane, but is there a way to with multiple satellites to beam 5TW of power to a single vessel?

Yes it is possible, however at the receiving end a percentage cannot be converted into power effectively and will end up a wasteheat. If you accumulated too much wasteheat, the receiver are going to get overheating will could eventually result in the receivers frying or radiators blowing up.
You know, i had this thought before:  i realize waste heat management is a core KSPI balance but i'd imagine the majority of waste heat could be recuperated as more power.

@SpaceMouse Yes that correct, Wasteheat is indeed the limiting factor when it comes to high power, and one of the primary means for me to balance the game. It's kind of like the classic strength versus endurance balance. You might have a system with a lot of potential strength, but without the endurance to back it up, you are not going to do it for very long before getting exhausted (running out of fuel/ getting overheated). The trick is getting the right mix of balance between strength and endurance, which depend what your goal is. If your intention is to launch in space, raw power is what you need, but if need to go very far, endurance is what you need more of.

Edited October 29, 2016 by FreeThinker

Helpfully this isn't a stupid question. Searching the topic/wiki and opening the WarpPluginSettings.cfg turned up nothing for me.

I want to change the modifier for the thermal helper.  It is activating whilst I'm typing in the parts search box.  I regularly take advantage of the tag searching to find parts from a massive list.  It looks like the "i" key is burned into the DLL rather than being changeable in the .CFG.  Or am I missing something obvious?

This is the second mod that is actuating while I'm focused in the search box.  It isn't clear to me if it is a bug in the plugin (some KSP state info that lets the plugin know the user is in the search box) or a limitation of Squad's VAB interface.

2 hours ago, NeuroticGamer said:

Helpfully this isn't a stupid question. Searching the topic/wiki and opening the WarpPluginSettings.cfg turned up nothing for me.

I want to change the modifier for the thermal helper.  It is activating whilst I'm typing in the parts search box.  I regularly take advantage of the tag searching to find parts from a massive list.  It looks like the "i" key is burned into the DLL rather than being changeable in the .CFG.  Or am I missing something obvious?

This is the second mod that is actuating while I'm focused in the search box.  It isn't clear to me if it is a bug in the plugin (some KSP state info that lets the plugin know the user is in the search box) or a limitation of Squad's VAB interface.

Currently it is hard code however, I look around and it turns out to be very easy to make it configurable (in next release), so I mad a little config setting (called ThermalUiKey) to allow you to configure it under a different key in the WarpPluginSetting.cfg

here is a list of all possible KeyCode

Edited October 29, 2016 by FreeThinker

1 hour ago, FreeThinker said:

Currently it is hard code however, Fortunately I look around and it turns out to be very easy to make it configurable (in next release), so I mad a little config setting (called ThermalUiKey) to allow you to configure it under a different key in the WarpPluginSetting.cfg

 

Woot!  Thanks!

17 hours ago, FreeThinker said:

@Ferigad

Before a transmitter can transmit, it need a source of Power in the specific medium your transmitter is capable of sending. In the case microwave transmitter, this is the Gyrotron. Currently, you need to have your transmitter connected directly to a Beam Generator, before it is able to transmit. Next release will make this more explicitly clear in the part descriptions. Note there are also secondary limitations, most transmitters are not suitable to act act as transmitter from the surface, this has to do with the ability to pivot, the transmitter mist be able transmit the microwave signal in any direction of the sky.

Awesome, thank you!

Edited October 30, 2016 by Ferigad

Apparently there is negative mass bug again.

No idea what causes it.

Also power managment fails to balance power properly - its 50 MW off.

Also hydrogen consumption by reactors is so low, that you can just use scoops on hydrogen sucking mode to fuel them.

Why scoops cant store gasses without liquifing them?

18 hours ago, FreeThinker said:

Currently it is hard code however, I look around and it turns out to be very easy to make it configurable (in next release), so I mad a little config setting (called ThermalUiKey) to allow you to configure it under a different key in the WarpPluginSetting.cfg

here is a list of all possible KeyCode

 

Awesome!  Thanks!
